headline: China Flexes Superpower Status Using Rare Earths in Global Supply Chain Grab
summary: The rules announced last week require overseas companies to obtain Chinese government approval before exporting products containing even trace amounts of certain rare earths that originated in China.  “After decades of striving, China finally has a few real technological advantages over America,” wrote Arthur Kroeber and Laila Khawaja at Gavekal Research in a Monday note.  EU Economy Commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis charged China with “using trade interdependencies for political gain,” speaking in Washington as global finance chiefs gathered for fall meetings of the International Monetary Fund and World Bank.

EU Economy Commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis charged China with “using trade interdependencies for political gain,” speaking in Washington as global finance chiefs gathered for fall meetings of the International Monetary Fund and World Bank.

headline: Why Tesla Stock Is Viewed As 'Must Own' With Elon Musk's Big Call Upcoming
summary: Tesla stock is viewed as a "must own" by a firm that initiated coverage Monday with third-quarter earnings due next week after strong quarterly vehicle deliveries.  TSLA shares angled lower early Tuesday after Monday's strong rebound.  Melius Research analyst Rob Wertheimer on Monday initiated coverage of Tesla stock, handing it a buy rating with a 520 price target, representing about 20% upside compared with the trading level at Monday's stock market close.

headline: Bengaluru-Based Airbound Secures $8.65M Seed Funding and Contract With Narayana Health to Enable One-Cent Drone Deliveries
summary: NEW YORK & BENGALURU, India, October 14, 2025--Airbound, an autonomous delivery logistics firm specializing in blended-wing-body aircraft, today announced $8.65 million in seed funding and a pilot partnership with Narayana Health.
